projects.title: Parasocialr
projects.description: This was the culmination of my Bootcamp, and I wanted to experiment a bit more with the knowledge I had. This app features User-auth with JWT tokens, infinite scrolling, and pull-down to refresh, full CRUD functionality in the user model, who can post photos and like others' in the main feed, and Restful API call to the back-end. I also learned about UX libraries such as Material-UI.

projects.title: Congressional Bill Tracker
projects.description: In this group project we decided to build an app so that users can keep track of the latest communications from their representatives, and bills that have been introduced, passed, and are active. We learned to use a state manager such as Redux to be flexible in our design.

projects.title: Pixel-Inventory
projects.description: In my second project, I decided to build an inventory application, with a friendly user interface. I utilized MongoDB as a database, with full CRUD functionality in one of the models. Being more comfortable with JavaScript, React helped me elevate my skills

projects.title: Pac-Smorc
projects.description: About two weeks into the bootcamp we were tasked to imitate a game mechanic using HTML, JavaScript, and CSS. It was definitely challenging, being my first time writing code, thankfully GA had provided me with enough resources for me to experiment and develop new skills.
